intro: Cola philipi-jonesii, commonly known as the Philippine cola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is typically found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
